abstracts.cdata!:
The Andhra Pradesh Cyclone Emergency
            Reconstruction Project consists of the following urgent
            reconstruction activities: (a) reconstruction and
            rehabilitation of irrigation and drainage systems in the
            delta areas; (b) reconstruction and repairs to roads and
            bridges, with particular attention for stabilizing slopes
            and repairing roads in hilly tribal areas; (c) construction
            of additional cyclone shelters; (d) repairing and
            strengthening electricity transmission systems, hospitals,
            water supplies, telephone exchanges and administrative
            centers; (e) rehabilitation of horticultural crops,
            facilities for inland fisheries and damaged ports; (f)
            construction of headworks for rural water distribution to
            villages most vulnerable to flood induced contamination; (g)
            reconstruction of municipal roads, drains and water
            supplied; (h) reconstruction of public buildings including
            elementary and primary schools and medical buildings; (i)
            construction of coastal shelter belts; (j) housing; and (k)
            technical assistance to finance technical studies to develop
            a plan to modernize water management in the delta and upland
            river areas; provide consultant services; training and
            equipment for the disaster awareness program; and to
            introduce non-governmental organizations in support of
            tribal development initiatives and in the fishing communities.
